headline.main: Women and Smoking Newest Research Shows the Health Toll Is Mounting; 30-Year, Fourfold Rise in Deaths

docs.abstract: J Brody article on women and smoking; notes 22,000 Amer women were found to have lung cancer in '77, and 23,000 were added to list in '78; nearly all were smokers, and nearly all will die of cancer; in '79, additional 30,000 women will be diagnosed as having lung cancer and projected 25,200 will die of disease; women who smoke over pack a day or who have been smoking at any level for over 30 yrs are 10 times more likely to die of lung cancer than nonsmokers; in last 3 decades, death from lung cancer among women has increased fourfold (L)

keywords.value: TOBACCO, TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND SMOKERS ARTICLES
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: "I never realized that by smoking I was killing myself not until I got lung cancer," said Jeanne Owens, a New York City artist who lost part of a lung two years ago and the rest of it last June when the cancer recurred.
docs.snippet: "I never realized that by smoking I was killing myself not until I got lung cancer," said Jeanne Owens, a New York City artist who lost part of a lung two years ago and the rest of it last June when the cancer recurred.
